Package eus.klimu.users.api

Class AccessController

java.lang.Object
eus.klimu.users.api.AccessController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/access")
public class AccessController
extends java.lang.Object
Manage the user access to the server, providing _Json Web Tokens_ to those users that have already been registered on the database. It also provides different methods to manage the access to the services.

  • Method Details

    • getUsernamePasswordToken

      @GetMapping("/auth/{token}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> getUsernamePasswordToken​(@PathVariable java.lang.String token)

      Get a UsernamePasswordToken from a JWT token. Transforms the UsernamePasswordToken into a JSON string.

      • Consumes: text/plain
      • Produces: text/plain
      • Requires: Access and Refresh tokens as headers.

      https://klimu.eus/RestAPI/access/auth/{token}

      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token that is going to be used for getting the UsernamePasswordToken.
      Returns:
      A 200 ok with the UsernamePasswordToken if everything went well. If not, returns a 400 bad request.

    • refreshTokens

      @GetMapping("/refresh") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> refreshTokens​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

      Get a new pack of tokens (accessToken and refreshToken) from the server as a JSON. Requires a request body with an access and a refresh token. One of the tokens need to not be expired for it to work.

      • Produces: application/json
      • Requires: Access and Refresh tokens as header.

      https://klimu.eus/RestAPI/access/refresh

      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest made to the server.
      Returns:
      A 200 ok with a json that contains the access and the refresh token. If not, returns a 400 bad request.

    • permissionDenied

      @GetMapping("/denied") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> permissionDenied()

      Obtains an error message as a JSON with a DENIED type of response.

      • Consumes: application/json, application/xml
      • Produces: application/json

      https://klimu.eus/RestAPI/access/denied

      Returns:
      A 403 error with a message explaining that the user has no authorities.
